snippet: Christine Lagarde, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, instead called for developing nations, the United States and Europe to move to a “full-speed” economy.
abstract: International Monetary Fund managing director Christine Legarde, speaking at news conference, calls for moving world into 'full-speed' economic recovery; warns that Europe has lagged behind rest of world in growth, and that better financial conditions and markets have not yet resulted in more jobs.

byline.contributor: Nicola Clark contributed reporting from Paris.

lead_paragraph: Christine Lagarde, managing director of the International Monetary Fund, instead called for developing nations, the United States and Europe to move to a “full-speed” economy.

headline.main: Monetary Fund Chief Warns Against ‘3-Speed’ Recovery
headline.print_headline: Monetary Fund Chief Warns Against ‘3-Speed’ Recovery
